questionnaire.name: Activity: Developing a participant value proposition
questionnaire.intro:
Before you reach out to potential participants, it is important to have a strong value proposition. A value proposition is a concise statement that paints a clear picture of what you program will offer the target audience, in case potential participants. If youâ€™re not sure where to start, refer to the creating compelling learning value propositions resource. This is intended as a starting point, and you will likely need to adjust this based on your target participants. 

Example: Our pre-apprenticeship prepares women for careers in construction by providing 12 weeks of free, hands-on and classroom instruction that will equip them with trade-specific skills and OSHA 10 certifications. 

Click "Answer the questions..." below to draft your own participant value proposition.

survey.name: Activity: Developing a partner value proposition
survey.title: Activity: Developing a participant value proposition
survey.thank_body:
Thank you for submitting your participant value proposition.

Remember, this template is just a starting point. You are encouraged to continue to refine your value proposition and adapt it to different audiences and contexts.

Click "Continue" to proceed to the next activity.

question.content:
Our ______________________ [program]

Prepares ____________________ [segment of adult participants]

For careers in ________________________________________________ [target industry]

By providing _________________________________________________ [activity(s)/service(s)]

That will _____________________________________________________ [key benefit(s) to participants].


(Required)
